{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":5406,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"double daffodil","description":"Double Daffodil, also known by the botanical name Narcissus 'Rose of May', is a perennial bulb plant characterized by its large, bi-coloured blooms. Its trumpet-shaped flowers have a pale yellow centre surrounded by a bright rose petal ring, often further decorated with a subtle rose baton on each petal. They can grow up to 25-30 cm, thriving in both full sun and partial shade, and tend to bloom in late spring and early summer. Its creamy and vibrant yellow blooms, appearing in early to mid-spring, add a cheerful note to the landscape and look stunning when planted in mass. It is commonly found in wet and marshy areas, near streams and rivers. Its bright green foliage and white flower clusters make it an attractive garden plant. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":5502,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"water celery","description":"Water Celery (Oenanthe javanica 'Flamingo') is an aquatic herb found near gentle waterways. With its vivid, glossy deep green leaves and bright pink stems, this plant is an eye-catching addition to any pond or water feature. It is hardy and easy to maintain, thriving in temperate climates with part-sunlight. It's fast growing with a rhizome that quickly spreads out over the water's surface to form a neat, low, mounded shape. Its delicate white flowers have a gentle fragrance and attract beneficial pollinators to the garden. In ponds, Water Celery helps filtrate water by removing nutrients that can contribute to harmful algae buildup. It's an excellent choice for those wishing to create something beautiful while also keeping their aquatic environment healthy.","family":"Apiaceae","flower_color":"White","flowering_season":null,"fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"Low","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":["red","pink"],"maintenance":"Moderate","origin":["Indonesia","Malaysia","Thailand","Vietnam","Laos","Cambodia","Myanmar","India"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Division","Cutting","Seed Propagation","Layering Propagation"],"pruning_month":["March","April","August","March","April","August","August"],"scientific_name":["Oenanthe javanica 'Flamingo'"],"soil":[],"watering_period":null}}

{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":5503,"attracts":["Birds"," Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"common evening primrose","description":"Common evening primrose (Oenothera biennis) is a tall, upright wildflower native to North America and Europe. It has long, lance-shaped leaves and yellow blossoms with four petals that open at night and close during the day. Each flower is cup-shaped and clustered in bunches at the top of the stem. Its stems and leaves are covered in fine hairs giving it a silvery sheen. Common evening primrose is traditionally used to soothe anxiety and promote relaxation. The plant is often utilized to make an herbal tea that acts as a sleep aid. The primrose's seeds can be eaten, utilized in herbal medicine, and are sometimes pressed for their oil. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":5413,"attracts":[],"care_level":null,"common_name":"cyclamineus daffodil","description":"Cyclamineus daffodil (Narcissus 'Stony Brook') is a popular spring-blooming bulb that produces multiple golden-yellow flowers. It has reflexed petals and an inward-curving cup with deep orange-rose markings. The flower stalks are sturdy and require little staking. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":5481,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"yellow pond lily","description":"Yellow pond lily (Nuphar lutea) is a submerged aquatic plant with heart-shaped floating leaves. They grow in shallow waters and produce large, bright yellow flowers in summer. The flowers have a sweet perfume scent and are attractive to pollinators. Its stems and leaves are covered in fine hairs giving it a silvery sheen. Common evening primrose is traditionally used to soothe anxiety and promote relaxation. The plant is often utilized to make an herbal tea that acts as a sleep aid. The primrose's seeds can be eaten, utilized in herbal medicine, and are sometimes pressed for their oil. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":5540,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"marjoram","description":"Marjoram is an evergreen perennial herb belonging to the mint family. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":5599,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":null,"common_name":"round-leaved ragwort","description":"Round-Leaved Ragwort (Packera obovata) is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a perennial wildflower, reaching a height of 1–3 ft with flower stalks rising above the leaves. The leaves are round to spoon-shaped and are divided into 3–7 lobes. The bright yellow daisy-like flowers bloom in long-branched clusters from April to August, although in cooler regions flowering can extend into October. This wildflower tolerates a wide range of soil conditions and grows best in moist, well-drained soils in full to partial sun. Its blooms attract a variety of bees and butterflies, making it an ideal addition to a native or pollinator garden.","family":"Asteraceae","flower_color":"Yellow","flowering_season":null,"fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"Low","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":["green"],"maintenance":"Moderate","origin":["Southeastern United States"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Seed Propagation","Division","Cutting","Layering Propagation"],"pruning_month":["March","April","May","February","March","April"],"scientific_name":["Packera obovata"],"soil":[],"watering_period":"morning"}}
